hints.content:
We can start with the $\blue{\text{low temperature}}$ after the storm, which was $\blue{20}$ $\blue{^\circ C}$, and add the $\pink{9}$ $\pink{^\circ C}$ back to it.

$\blue{20} + \pink{9} = \green{\Box}$

![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/2fae2cb98a11d4f72ca457679ce2b586.png)
The temperature was $\green{29}$ $\green{^\circ C}$ before the tropical storm.

question.content:
It was a beautiful day in Hawaii.  Then a tropical storm blew in, making the temperature drop by $9$  $^\circ C$ down to a temperature of $20$ $^\circ C$.

**What was the temperature before the storm?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] $^\circ C$
